title: St. Ignatius of Loyola College, Caracas
text:
St. Ignatius of Loyola College, Caracas, ("Colegio San Ignacio de Loyola") is a <a href="Private%20school">private</a> <a href="Catholic%20school">Catholic</a> primary and secondary school located in <a href="Caracas">Caracas</a>, <a href="Venezuela">Venezuela</a> Founded by the <a href="Jesuits">Jesuits</a> in 1923, the school is coeducational, and covers pre-primary through high school.
History.
Ignatius College was founded in 1923 with the encouragement of the <a href="Catholic%20church">Catholic</a> <a href="Archbishop">Archbishop</a>. In 1940 the college received a new building. In the early 1950s it moved to Chacao at Av. Sta Teresa de Jesus, its present location.
